channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2023081031
item.description:
Report E-2023081031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one 1884 pound large battery (un2794) had tipped over during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and had released 10 gallons of acid. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023081053
item.description:
Report X-2023081053

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE UNLOAD BAY DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT. RESPONDER CAME ACROSS PACKAGE SITTING OUTSIDE OF TRAILER ON THE UNLOADING DOCK. PACAKGE WAS DAMP ON THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER PLACED CONTENTS AND PACKAGE IN DMN TRAY. RESPONDER FOLLOWED ALL THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. RESPONDER BROUGHT LEAKING PACKAGE TO DMP PROCESSING AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023080915
item.description:
Report X-2023080915

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: JONESBORO
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat pkg was on a closure cart in the middle area by our chutes where the closures and misloads go. I had checked on the package earlier to see where it needed to go, and did not see any leaking around the package. Someone had grabbed the cart that the package was on, and put it on the rollers attached to the chute, and about 30 minutes later, I heard the manager call out that there was a leaking Hazmat. I ran over to the area, and the manager, a PH, and another QA were picking up the leaking, corrosive Hazmat with their bare hands, putting it into a tote, and making the package leak everywhere. I immediately told them to set the package down and to clear the area. I let them know that it was a corrosive liquid and that it could burn them. They had already set it on the tugger, and it was leaking all over the back of the tugger as well. They set it down, and I grabbed it, and put it on my QA cart. When I set it on the cart, the liquid splashed up on my arms and on my left leg (as I was wearing shorts), and it started burning my skin. I told them to immediately clear the area, go rinse their hands, and I took my cart to the QA area, and hurried to the Hazmat shower to start rinsing my arms and leg off. After I had rinsed off for about 8 to 10 mins, I then went back and got the tugger that had been leaked on, and took it to the QA area to put it out of order. I then took my QA cart to the Hazmat cage and put the damaged portion of the package into a lined salvage drum. DescribePack: Package failed due to a loose cap on one of the bottles of Warewashing Detergents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I went to the spill area, and put the chemical neutralizer onto the spilled liquid and then put the shredded absorbing material onto it as well. I put caution tape over the area, and the next morning, I pH tested several spots, as well as the spots on the tugger, and then put down more neutralizer as needed. I then waited until about 11:00a that morning to sweep up the neutralizer and absorbing material into a hazardous material bag, and place it into the salvage drum with the other damaged portion of the damaged package.

item.title: Report E-2023080865
item.description:
Report E-2023080865

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: E-2023080865 During off loading it was discovered that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of hydrochloric acid (un1789) had been punctured by a sharp object and had released 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release. E-2023080907-During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of hydrochloric acid (un1789) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 10 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
